course.subject: LANG
course.name: Spanish and the Other America
course.description: This is a course for learners with no previous knowledge of Spanish. It aims to offer students a foundation in Spanish language and related culture, with an emphasis on practical oral communication. It presents aspects of essential Spanish and Latin American cultures, the flamenco to the salsa, from the temples of the Incas to the architecture of Gaudi. By the end of the course, students will be able to communicate appropriately in Spanish on a variety of everyday topics.

reviews.author: avv
reviews.title: Must Take Course
reviews.comment_content:
Quite basic Spanish- just dealing with the first 3 units in the textbook. Mostly about phrases, numbers 1-100, verbs, adjectives, grammar etc.

Spanish in terms of pronunciation is quite straightforward  and you'd need to keep in mind how to pronounce certain letters when reciting words. Depending on your linguistic background, the 'rolling r' sound could be challenging as well as the lisp sound in words- but that is less challenging and not required if you consider other Spanish dialects outside Spain i.e in Latin America.

Verbs in particular can be pretty confusing as for every form- "you play", "I play", "They play", "we play" there is a different word for each form so that will take some time to get used it and it is highly recommended to pay attention to the verbs.

Otherwise other vocabulary can be learnt without much difficulty as they share so many words with English and is helpful if your English vocabulary is fairly wide.

Nothing too challenging in Spanish compared to German and if you have learnt a Romance language before, it would be very easy I'd suppose.

Book is expensive from the bookstore, so try buying second hand or getting an online version
reviews.comment_teaching: Ana is a great teacher, super sweet and humorous. Explanation is crystal clear and always ready to help out. She doesn't want to put pressure on people so you will feel that this class doesn't feel anything like a typical UST class with people competing insanely just to get a B grade.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is amazing- just pay close attention in class and do the revision exercises given. Also participation matters and will account into your grade. Easy to get a minimum B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Manageable workload.

- Midterm
- Cultural presentation
- Video project
- Final

For the Cultural presentation and video, you will need to work in groups and it is recommended to obviously group someone you can get along with well.

reviews.author: Maurice
reviews.title: Love it! Best course in UST (imo)
reviews.comment_content: Very basic Spanish. First four chapters of the textbook, Â¡Nos vemos! 1, will be taught. Content includes numbers, greetings, basic physical descriptions, a bit verbs and adjectives.
reviews.comment_teaching: Really good. Many activities in class to make sure students understand and know how to speak the language.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation                 10%
Midterm Exam              20%
PPT Presentation         15%
Video Presentation       10%
Final Written Exam        25%
Oral Exam                     20%

Just like other LANG courses, if you have missed 25% of the classes, you will fail the course. So do not skip classes! In fact, you will it difficult to catch up after skipping one class because there are too many to be covered in one session.

Though many of the students are from GBUS, no one have failed this course ever, according to the instructor. So don't need to worry that much even you feel you are not as good as the others.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 exams and 2 projects. Exams are not very difficult if you have prepared well. The first project is a powerpoint presentation, introduce some Spanish culture to your classmates. The other project is to make a movie to show how Spanish culture influence Hong Kong.

Do remember to take notes in class!! Some of the content could not found in the textbook.

reviews.author: unomyname
reviews.comment_content:
Greetings, pronunciation, verbs, introducing yourself/your family/your friends, numbers, masculine and feminine, etc. 3 units of content.
One read aloud test in the middle of the semester, a comprehensive reading, listening and speaking test for final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear teaching yet sometimes the pace is a bit too fast. Always compliment the classmates no matter our answers are right or wrong.
reviews.comment_grading: Nice grading. Ana is encouraging and ease on grades. Just have to make sure that you pay close attention in class and try your best to not skipping classes.
reviews.comment_workload: Attendance is required for every class, 3 discussions on canvas throughout the semester, one essay and one presentation.

reviews.author: therock
reviews.comment_content: If you like the sound of Spanish and are genuinely interested in learning it, the content is great! It covers basics-- nothing too complicated. But, by the end, you feel confident enough to have a slow 5 minute conversation with someone in Spanish, which is pretty cool after only 1 semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ana is the best! She has so much energy, and is very Spanish which is fun for a change with all other UST profs. She's helpful in correcting pronunciation and explaining why certain things are the way they are, but sometimes she may go a bit too slow.
reviews.comment_grading: Amazing grading! She never released SDs, but I think it might be absolute grading (not 100% sure though). I got an A+, and had above 90% for all the quizzes/assignments, even when there were some mistakes, so pretty generous I would say.
reviews.comment_workload: Group presentation and essay are probably the heaviest workload components, but they aren't too bad (as compared to other classes). Otherwise, you only need to go over class notes briefly before each assessment, as they aren't too difficult.

reviews.author: Darwin1117
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Spanish. Just first few chapters of the book.
Content includes basic grammar, how to ask questions in Spanish class in Spanish, numbers, verbs and adjectives, basic introduction of yourself, family

Spanish words are easy to pronounce, you can pronounce a word that you haven't seen before.

Listening is rather hard to pick up since Spanish people talk really fast.

Spanish words are similar to English words, good English speaker may found that some words in Spanish are similar with English.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ana is a good teacher.
She is very nice and love to help students.
The pace is moderate.
reviews.comment_grading:
Moderate to Good.

Most of the students in this course are above year 2 or gbus student.
Year 1 students are encouraged to take this course too, if you are really interested in Spanish. (since i take this course in year 1 too, it's really not that hard for yr1 as others think :) )

Ana is a very generous instructor.
B-range is very easy to get if you follow the instructions on class.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light Workload.

No assignment, no mid-term.
Final and a presentation.
Presentation should be done around the topic she gives you.
Final includes listening test, oral test and writing test.

reviews.author: myw
reviews.comment_content: Introducing ourselves, numbers, restaurant orders, basic professions, and the types of food.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching was quite good. You can engage and focus in the class easily.
reviews.comment_grading:
For me it was only C-. But that's probably because I did not study and prepare well.
For the written exam, you have to wirte 50 words free style introducing yourself in Spanish with the materials you have learned in class. There were also listening test,vocabulary exam and reading exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload from the instructor was not much. Still, you have to pay consistent effort to revise the course material

reviews.author: Weird Guy
reviews.comment_content: Content is about the basics. We learn about introducing ourselves, numbers, restaurant orders, basic professions, and the types of food. We learnt some grammar and obtained a deeper understanding of the Spanish culture. The language is not so difficult to learn, compared to other languages as Spanish has many similarities with English.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was great. As the class size was small, interactions with the professor and other students were easy. The instructor Ana is a very friendly person. In our last lecture, she cooked Spamish food for us!
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is excellent. Easy A range if you follow whatever she mentions in class. Do take her notes down as she always includes her stuff on the exams (especially the parts which are not in the textbook)
reviews.comment_workload: There was a midterm and final that did not require much of study. An open book writing task was conducted, and the instructor really helps us in the speaking task. There are group presentations about various aspects of Spanish culture.

reviews.author: olle
reviews.title: Strongly Recommended. Easy A+ with the nicest professor ever
reviews.comment_content:
Spanish is so similar to English that almost all the words are spelled just like English.
Ana teaches us both language and Spanish culture which makes the course even more interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ana gives a clear explanation on grammar, sentence structure, and vocabularies.
She is one of the most caring and understanding professors so she always makes herself available to help her students understand the content.
She also is really flexible with students' schedules and emergencies (I was really sick so missed an exam but she let me take it in a different date even with short notice)
reviews.comment_grading:
The course is based on an absolute evaluation so you do not have to compete with your classmates like we usually do in other courses.
I got an A+ without having to be stressed out all the time.
She gives you a good grade as long as you show your effort!
1 midterm + 1 final + attendance + 1 project
reviews.comment_workload:
You might have to work on homework most of the weeks but they are not that challenging.
The project require about an hour in total, which is really light.

reviews.author: Na
reviews.comment_content:
From everyday greetings, basic grammars, numbers to cuisine, etc.

If you have learnt other European languages before like French or Italian, you will find the grammatical part easy as  same rule applies. So I recommend you to take Spanish again once you have studied other European languages.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Full of laugh in Ana's class. She is humorous and she loves to share her own experience in Spain. Discussion of Spanish cultures between us and her comes so naturally and she welcomes students to ask questions. She is kind and compassionate.

The shortcoming is that she sometimes forgets where she stops last class and also the materials she has covered. Hence, you might find something you aren't familiar with in the exam but fortunately, the exam stuff are tiny so studying those extra stuff won't cause your burden.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance
1 Mid term
1 Group project (Presenting Spanish culture in English)
1 in-class written assessment ( 150 words )
1 oral test
1 Final

I forgot the weighting of the assessment but I think they are pretty much the same.

Awesome grading. My friend and I got A range though we aren't sure about others' performance.
reviews.comment_workload:
Though there are a lot to do, the workload is low. Throughout the semester, only three chapters has been covered. Also, Ana will tell you the specific parts to be tested and assessed in written and oral in advance so just recite those parts and you will get good scores.

For group project, do pay efforts in making it more interesting.

reviews.author: wtleeae
reviews.title: Fun easy going teacher
reviews.comment_content: Content is quite easy and beginner-friendly as the course is designed for someone who has completely no knowledge about the language (me). Basically self-introductions, basic tenses (I am, He has), pronunciations and greetings etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Fun and engaging, especially if you yourself are already interested in learning a new language. Since it is a beginners' course, Ana tries to keep it simple so as to not intimidate students.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is very good in my opinion, have 0 Spanish knowledge prior to this course and managed to get A+; judging by other student's performances, if you know how to make your presentations creative and ask questions here and then, A range should not be difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: The only workload that is quite big is the cultural essay but you can choose your own topic, as long as it is something related to Spanish culture. Otherwise, there are many other tasks but all are very beginner level.
